Description: Gold finger-ring; hollow hoop, rounded without and expanding at the ends into roughly-shaped heads of serpents; in these have been set pear-shaped garnets (one now missing); between the ends of the hoop is soldered a crescent-shaped setting containing a garnet of that form.
Bibliographic references: Finger Ring / Catalogue of the Finger Rings, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum (814)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Rev Greville John Chester
